From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • empiyorar

Etymology

[edit]

From Early Medieval Latin impeiōrāre, from Latin peiōrem (“worse”). By surface analysis, en- +‎ peor +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /empeoˈɾaɾ/ [ẽm.pe.oˈɾaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: em‧pe‧o‧rar

Verb

[edit]

empeorar (first-person singular indicative present empeoro, past participle empeoráu)

  1. (transitive) to worsen (transitive: make worse)
  2. (intransitive) to worsen (intransitive: get worse)

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of empeorar
infinitive empeorar
gerund empeorando
past participle m empeoráu, f empeorada, n empeorao, m pl empeoraos, f pl empeoraes

Related terms

[edit]
  • peor

Further reading

[edit]
  • Xosé Lluis García Arias (2002–2004), “empeorar”, in Diccionario general de la lengua asturiana [General Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Spanish), Editorial Prensa Asturiana, →ISBN
  • “empeorar”, in Diccionariu de la llingua asturiana [Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Asturian), 1ª edición, Academia de la Llingua Asturiana, 2000, →ISBN

Galician

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • empiorar

Etymology

[edit]

From Early Medieval Latin impeiōrāre, from Latin peiōrem (“worse”). By surface analysis, en- +‎ peor +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /empeoˈɾaɾ/ [em.peoˈɾaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Hyphenation: em‧pe‧o‧rar

Verb

[edit]

empeorar (first-person singular present empeoro, first-person singular preterite empeorei, past participle empeorado)

  1. to worsen

Conjugation

[edit]

Related terms

[edit]
  • empeoramento

Further reading

[edit]
  • “empeorar”, in Dicionario da Real Academia Galega (in Galician), A Coruña: Royal Galician Academy, 2012–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Early Medieval Latin impeiōrāre, from Latin peiōrem (“worse”). By surface analysis, en- +‎ peor +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /empeoˈɾaɾ/ [ẽm.pe.oˈɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: em‧pe‧o‧rar

Verb

[edit]

empeorar (first-person singular present empeoro, first-person singular preterite empeoré, past participle empeorado)

  1. (transitive) to worsen, to make worse, to exacerbate
  2. (intransitive) to get worse, to deteriorate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of empeorar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)

gerund empeorando

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
